website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link DIR-605L Cloud Router makes a great solution for those who just need a simple wireless network to share the Internet access among devices. Its cloud-based management feature also proves to be a helpful and practical bonus.
pros: The entry-level D-Link DIR-605L Cloud Router is affordable and easily manageable via the Internet, using a browser or mobile apps
The networking device also offers decent performance and a stable wireless signal
cons: Apart from the cloud-based novelty, the DIR-605L is a frills-free wireless router that lacks many common features found in others, such as Gigabit Ethernet, dual-band, the support for the IPv6, or guest networking

customer_reviews.title: A really nice and really cheap router!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this router. It's easy to set up, signal strength is good, and it has a cool security feature where you can ban all devices from connecting unless they have the right MAC address, for a little extra protection. Instead of replacing my old wireless DSL modem/router combo I plugged this into it and then disabled the wifi on the DSL modem. Now I have newer, more secure wifi hanging off the old modem. It's pretty small and doesn't get terribly hot either. Been working fine for a few weeks now with no issues relating to bandwidth or reliability.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor product along with poor warranty service
customer_reviews.text: Worthless router and worthless warranty. I have 60mbs service. When a cable is used I get near the 60mbs of service. When using wifi I only get 15 to 20 and some times 0. I missed my 30 day return as I was dealing with family issues. Called tech support with Dlink and was told that I should expect a 50 to 60 percent loss of speed with wifi. I don't believe the poor tech support person was given the tools to do their job. I won't purchase Dlink again. Be warned!
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Bill

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to something else.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only 6 months. Purchase two more but "updated" software fails. Even when brand new they reject all user names and passwords including those pasted on the unit. Can no longer access 192.168.0.1 for setup or to change settings in both later models. You are not saving any money by purchasing this unit. And after a manual reset they still find the outdated and worthless user name and password....so either it stores data in a hidden file on the hard drive or somewhere on line. Today two improved versions go in the trash...I've wasted enough time trying to get them to work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Donald

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls Don't Work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router specifically because of the ability for it to block websites. There is a section in the gateway to do so. However, when you try to block a site, it does not work. I called D-link several times and they "troubleshot" and "escalated" the issue. I spent HOURS on the phone. Long story short, it cannnot block https sites, which is almost every site. This router continuously drops the wireless signal. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Customer Technical Support
customer_reviews.text: I have called technical support twice since buying this product, First to assist me with set up and tonight because Time Warner--my internet provider--could not solve the speed/buffering problem and had me unhook everything, would not assist reconnecting and left me without internet. Fortunately for me, Jasmine, AR004213 at D-Link, completely solved my continuous buffering problem--case # C6479770. She, patiently provided step-by-step instructions to reconnect my router and change the channel. Her clearly understood directions, conveyed in a professional, knowledgeable way, completely lowered my previously frustrated mind and just reaffirmed my high opinion of the D-Link company, its products and most importantly--its highly trained employees! Thank you D-Link! Jasmine deserves a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: 'boro Gram

customer_reviews.title: The web User interface is not as good but at the price of $20
customer_reviews.text: I tested the download speed with my home Comcast 200mbps package: 40mbps. It serves as the 2nd router well. Do not buy it as the primary router if your home internet's download is > 40mbps. The web User interface is not as good but at the price of $20, it's OK. Bad .asp code in the router's web pages made it ugly and difficult to modernize. D-Link should stay away from Microsoft ASP active server page technology and use open source technology for its web pages. Most Microsoft tech is history.
customer_reviews.author: Hil

customer_reviews.title: Decent WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router because it's compatible with the D-Link network cameras I purchased, and it is compatible with the cameras. However the router has very few settings as far as I can see, though they may be hidden in the back end. I am a network administrator and I'm use to seeing wireless devices that have hundreds of settings. As far as I can tell the D-Link has just a handful of settings. That's not a bad thing, if you want an easy to install WiFi router for your home, this router will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: W Olson

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years, then suddenly died.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: The price. This is really the only reason I got it. CONS: The range and strength are pretty poor. I could access the internet without any problems in the same room, but as soon as I went to the adjacent room the signal would drop significantly. Also it didn't last very long. After a year it started acting funny and stopped sending the internet to my brand new laptop, and after another few months it just died one day. I've since replaced it with a different router and have had no issues. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Pikmeir

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Dir 605L
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router as a cheap replacement until I find a good AC router. DOESN'T WORK WITH IP V6 (it is listed as ipv6 compliant but as of 5/25/2014 it is not and from what i found on DLink's website it will not be) Pros: price was cheap, works well, ok range, good speed Cons: listed as Ipv6 but is not.... other router in this price range work just as well that are ipv6 compliant, where as only a few sites ( however the list is growing). Bottom line: I would not buy again, other better router for similar prices
customer_reviews.author: Empiror22

customer_reviews.title: Do not attempt to use without a code upgrade
customer_reviews.text: It has worked well . I wish the manufacturer mentioned "to do an update prior to using it". I spent three evenings trying to configure it. The fact that it did not work “out of the box” should have told me that something was wrong. The code upgrade is an option in the device menu. Once the upgrade was done it worked as expected without any further requirements. Good range and stable signal. It has worked better than the old D-link that was giving me trouble. If it wasn't for the code upgrade I give it 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: newbie

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for high speed internet.
customer_reviews.text: Do not expect to get full speed if your internet uses 5 GHz bandwidth. Called the customer service several times to deal with this problem and NONE of the "technicians" told me about that. They are very unprepared. After several calls, I was just told that I should not expect more than 50% speed of my internet if I'm using wifi, regardless of the distance from the modem, signal interference, etc. This can be a good router for low-speed internet, but not for high speed.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz

customer_reviews.title: It Just Works, Has Great Range
customer_reviews.text: Old router was a Belkin thing, bought for $80 at Frys a couple of years ago. Damn thing would crash several times a day, and could not reach the wifi TV on the other side of the house. Installed this new D=Link router. Setup was genius easy: the first time you try to access the internet, it pushes you through a setup web site and you are good to go. It's been there for a day and has never crashed. And it *CAN* reach the TV on the other side of the house, no problem at all. Nice high bandwidth Netflix & Amazon streams. Yay! And it was only $35. So satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Crispin Cowan

customer_reviews.title: ... access point for my lower level and it works great. I ran a hard wire from my upper ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a access point for my lower level and it works great. I ran a hard wire from my upper level ( cat 6 ) to this device and now have excellent wireless for the entire lower level and also for out my house. The price was also great. Would buy again anytime. Was easy to set up also. Allen E
customer_reviews.author: Allen Erb

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were pretty much pointless. I spent an hour reading how to get this thing to work when I've done similar projects a million times. It took a call to D-link and another hour to get the info that you need to change the addy from 168.192.0.1 to 192.168.5.1 Two hours for one digit! It seems to send signal fine but all of my machines take far too long to connect to the network. even though it is in the memory of all and the only one within range. I didn't use (or care for) the cloud option just the speed, which seems to be decent once it gets connected.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this and glad it has external antennas
customer_reviews.text: This was a great choice. It has excellent range and was very easy to configure in either manual or automatic setup options. Signal strength is very good within my 1000 sq. ft. apartment and no signs of server channel interference with the other 20 or so networks near by. Tried to use the mycloud option to see what kind of information is available, but it doesn't seem to really introduce that much more functionality other than being able to see your network remotely. The pricing of this item is just right. Overall if your in need of a new router with n-band capabilities and significant range, this might be the product for you
customer_reviews.author: MSE fanatic

customer_reviews.title: VERY good for it's pricepoint.
customer_reviews.text: If your internet speed is less than 300Mbps buy this, you won't be disappointed. If you rely on extremely low latency, probably should save a little more money. However this can handle whatever I throw at it in terms of downloading/uploading. Honestly, if you add this to your ISP router in an open area, it is ages better than the sub-par wifi included when you buy your internet. I have some 300$ fancy router that can compete with this one in an open area, enough said. P.S. A simple google search about how wifi systems and wifi adapters work may benefit you more when purchasing this router.
customer_reviews.author: Chantha K

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Verizon router
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace a Verizon router. The Verizon router had very poor wireless performance and had cryptic port forwarding capability. The Dlink unit solved both problems. The wireless connections now come up in a few seconds instead of minutes and the port forwarding we needed to setup was easily done. The only problem in setting things up had to do with the AVG fire wall and had nothing to do with the Dlink. a side benefit is that the Dlink only uses about 4 watts while the Verizon was about 15 watts. As these things run 24 hour, that is about a $10/year difference.
customer_reviews.author: mhubel

customer_reviews.title: Over one year in use and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in may of 2014 and it's now 2016. I am impressed with it's performance. I had left it at 100% transmit power until recently. I just set it to 15% transmit power and I am still getting 'four bars' or 'good' transmit level on my upstairs computer and the router is located downstairs. I also have it as a wired connection for some devices and it works good that way too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: A kick *** product!
customer_reviews.text: Many laptops' internal wireless cards don't support the 5GHz range. The N 300 router is great. delivers plenty of speed for streaming online videos through the wireless, coverage is great and best of all, to configure it with cable internet is always a breeze. Compared to linksys products which stop working after a while and netgear's genie config wizard which always has problems establishing connections the 1st time, the D-link products are a solid buy for homes, home offices and small businesses. All my switches and routers are D-link. Have not gone wrong with them. Do recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: D-link not for me
customer_reviews.text: I did not enjoy using this wireless router. It had a difficult time finding or connecting to the 2 Chromecast devices I use in my home and it could not provide signal coverage to my entire home which is only 1500 sqft. I returned it and purchased a NETGEAR N450 WiFi DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem Router (N450-100NAS). I said goodbye to my cable modem fee of $8 per month. Having both the cable modem and wireless router in one device is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: pdg55

customer_reviews.title: Dropped the Internet connection multiple times/day.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer my technology to work. When it comes to a router, specifically, it should connect to the Internet via the modem, and stay that way. I installed this router to replace my last D-link that gave me a good life of service. This one, however, would drop the internet connection several times a day, and required rebooting every time. Other routers worked fine, so it was just this one. No thanks. It''s going back.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great once set up
customer_reviews.text: Works great once set up. No more dead spots in my 2400 square foot single story. I get anywhere from the full 50 to about 25 mps, depending on how far away. It is located on one end of the house. Unfortunately, cannot locate it centrally. Great price for a good router, if you don't need it to be any faster or more range. Have only had to reset it once in 4 months and that was from a power outage. Don't know why that fouled it up, but I don't blame that on the router.
customer_reviews.author: Crimedog

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working great for an apartment
customer_reviews.text: This router was relatively easy to install, had to review a couple of steps but it didn't take that long. As for performance we're not heavy wi-fi users. Just a tablet and ipod for internet browser, and a roku for streaming tv. I don't know how it would perform with games and heavier use. I live in a medium to large apartment and I have wi fi in every area of it. It has worked great, I get fast internet and it has been reliable. Haven't had any problems with it so far, even streaming movies is fast. If you need a basic, non-expensive router this one has done the job.
customer_reviews.author: Meno

customer_reviews.title: get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: this router is super basic, so if your someone looking for super fast, dual band and etc.....this is not the wireless router you should buy. i have an old and basic netgear G and it runs 54mbps, and this new d-link it's just a little bit better when it comes to speed and range. the only reason i didn't return it's because it does it's job when it comes down to streaming wirelessly from my blu-ray player downstairs. (d-link wireless router is located upstairs in my master bedroom) also, the cloud app is useless, don't even bother....
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Nice router, nice price!
customer_reviews.text: Nice basic router, especially for the price. Setup was a breeze, and speed and range are good. I have a smaller home, ~1400 square feet. The router sits on a desk by an outside wall of the house. I can connect with my phone anywhere in the house, and for a short distance outside. My Chromecast works perfectly with this router, and it's on the opposite end of the house. One reason I chose this one is that it's been around for a couple of years, and I figured if it was junk it would've been discontinued by now.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bennett

customer_reviews.title: OK Until
customer_reviews.text: I tried streaming a Denon 3313CL AVR through this router through ethernet cable. It was unable to assign the Denon an ip address. My other devices linked easily, wired and wireless, but when I connected the Denon, everything went south. Port forwarding didn't seem to work. If you are an IT genius and really know how to tweak all this, go for it. Otherwise, I think there are better products that support Upnp seemlessly. Tech support is always overseas and often difficult to understand. The wait is always long. Very frustrating. I'm getting a new different router. We are all so addicted to our internet.
customer_reviews.author: B Diddley

customer_reviews.title: Worked once, didn't work the second time.
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great for 6 months. Then I moved and wanted to use it again and it wouldn't work/set up properly. Did not find the tech support helpful. Used a friend's old router instead. Can't believe it didn't work when I moved and tried to reuse it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Smooth linking :o)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to add another wireless access point in my house for streaming videos. The installation was a breeze. Aver all the performance is good, I am having problem with my computer connecting to this router, it drops the connection too often, but I think its the windows operating system issue cuzz I have the same problem when I connect to the other router. I have also heard this complaint from my uncle about windows 7 machine. Over all I am pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ali

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: It is reliable and cheap. Still works. Make sure to try different radio channels on your WiFi router as many people complain that their WiFi router doesn't work or quit working. Usually, the problem is someone else near you is probably using the same radio channel.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S.

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I only needed something for a one bedroom apartment with only one laptop and a Kindle, this is quite sufficient for my needs. Excellent signal at all times in all parts of the apartment, no problems whatsoever with that. Setup was easy but the process of naming the device and assigning passwords was confusing, it could definitely be clearer. When I assigned a name to the device it ended up using it as a password instead and I still haven't figured out how to get back in to change it. This doesn't affect the operation at all though, I've had it for a month now and it has functioned flawlessly in that time.
customer_reviews.author: rlavallee

customer_reviews.title: Great reception and easy to add to the established network
customer_reviews.text: Great reception and easy to add to the established network. I purchased to have the D-Link home cloud with my home video cameras. Did take a little bit to organize the camera but had nothing to do with this router... mush more to do with the non-tech savy guy behind the network.
customer_reviews.author: Casey G

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up and very effective for me.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a basic router, my first, to have some wifi for my phone, and this did the trick. Better range than I expected for such a little inexpensive thing.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It fixed my what airport extreme couldn't
customer_reviews.text: Great device! I had an airport extreme and could not get it to extend my network for my pc at the other end of my home. I don't know much about the network settings but the apple setup ask a couple of questions and extended the network. Yeah, it didn't work so well. The pc keep getting on and off the network. Even my Xbox would jump on and off the network. To make this long story short I chucked the airport extreme after installing this beauty! It took me through the setup and ALL my PC/Microsoft based equipment works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Good most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my very old netgear router. It was fairly easy to install and set up. The app that controls it is pretty handy to block specific devices and to re-boot it if needed. I have had it for a few months now and have had to completely unplug and reset it 2 or 3 times now. I dont think its that big of deal since I was having to reset my old router on a near daily basis. I would still recommend this router and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage and false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Garbage and false advertising. This router claims to handle 300mbs speeds but the ports on it actually max out at 100. Once I hooked it up things got even slower. Around 70mbs wired connection and around 27mbs over wifi. Double checked to make sure the firmware was up to date which it was. Absolutely terrible.
customer_reviews.author: critz1184

customer_reviews.title: works great, easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: Being a computer novice, I was skeptical that I would be able to set this up without any help. The set up turned out to be really easy and the router works great. Technical support is available if needed and they walked me through a small glitch I had (my fault, not theirs) step by step very patiently. The support technician asked me to write a review for her since she resolved my problem, which I am happy to do. Her id number is AR004235.
customer_reviews.author: kellw

customer_reviews.title: Reliably worked for almost a year. Not happy with the customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted me about 11 months, in this time period I have experienced no network issues from this router. Currently trying to contact their technical support, for the past couple of hours, they're automated call system is not very well setup, I was holding for half an hour and the call drops me. There never seems to be a technical support person available. The fine print in their 1 year warranty requires that you troubleshoot the product with them for assessment, so this is a bit of catch-22.
customer_reviews.author: NatashaThePup

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use when traveling and Chromecast or Roku won't work on the Hotel's WiFi network and the room has an Ethernet jack. Setup is easy from my notebook and the connection is nice and reliable. I have not lost connection once. I watch streaming movies from Amazon, Netflix and Hulu on my Notebook, Tablet, and on TV via Chromecast or Roku. Only comes with one ethernet cable, you'll need two. One plugged into Internet source, and one plugged into your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Longoria

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I had a Trendnet Wireless G Router which I bought for $5 under some deal 3 years back.It was working fine until recently , it started giving problems like rebooting itself automatically and also it reduces my 30Mbps line to about 12Mbps. So I was in search of something that can be better replacement without dropping my speed. Found lot of positive reviews about this and ordered. Shipping was super quick. Plugged that in and found what ?? My wifi speed reduced to 8-9Mbps with not so strong signal even in the room where I am standing. Returned it immediately and seriously disaapointed
customer_reviews.author: Pankaj

customer_reviews.title: Awesome D-Link WirenessN 300
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and in great condition. I had some difficulty setting it up but the customer service via phone was awesome! Got me up and running the same day I got the product. It's been working great ever since. I love it from D-Link and would recommend it. Great connection - no problems. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Dash

customer_reviews.title: it's a router so it suffers the usual issues of needing perfect placement and burnout
customer_reviews.text: we use this as a second wi-fi hub as well as a ethernet hub for the bedrooms. works well and rarely needs to be reset. it's a router so it suffers the usual issues of needing perfect placement and burnout, but much less than the supplied router from my isp.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Router
customer_reviews.text: I was having signal strength issues with a previous router, and this has solved those problems. I also chose this router b/c it has a cloud feature. There is an app for iOS and Android devices, which allows remote management and monitoring of the router and devices connected to it. Unfortunately, I have found that you cannot connect to the router when connect using 3G/4G network; you must be on the router's network. Hopefully this is something that gets corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Mister.MurphyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Too easy!!
customer_reviews.text: I connected this router to the "internet" side of the AT&T U-verse gateway. I thought I was going to have security\setup problems. NOT! It was too easy. In fact used my smartphone to setup the router and not a PC as stated in the Quick Setup guide. Turned WiFi ON, on the phone, it found DLink, connected up to the router's setup, secured the router, added the password and that was it!! All other devices connected without problems, PC, iPad, Kindle and printer.
customer_reviews.author: MegaB LC

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Had difficulty with initial set up but after several phone calls, got it working. worked OK or a while (2-3 months), but now it shuts off continually throughout the day. I often have to manually search for the network on my android and sometimes receive error messages that there is a problem with my network. Never had these issues when I had a Net Gear router. After 8 years, the Net Gear router died, and I bought the D-Link router after reading a review on C-Net. Its a real pain and I don't think the cheaper price is worth the constant aggravation. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C. Strachan

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Wireless
customer_reviews.text: I received this product immediately and I had no problem hooking it up and going through the steps to activate it. I don't know a lot about routers but I do believe I probably needed a unit that had more Mbps. I get great signals when I am close to the unit but in different parts of my house the signal is very weak. If I was to rebuy a new router I would by another D-link because it is a good product but one that had a stronger signal.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: I researched this router on C-Net before buying...I have to say, it was fairly easy to set up, and it's a few months later: so far, so good. It gets excellent reach in the kitchen, with the router being placed in the bedroom of my one-story, but fairly spacious apartment. If I have any problems with it, I'll come back and amend the review. Also, please keep in mind that the relatively large duel-antenna footprint is not an issue for me, and I have no use (yet) for the "cloud" function, but the C-Net reviewer seemed impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: What a great little router
customer_reviews.text: What a great little router. Did some research and this brand came out on top. Oh course I zipped over to Amazon and they had it. They have everything right!! So set it up and the signal is beyond great very far reaching. Easy set up of course using it for wifi with iPhone and iPads. Set it up in less then five minutes. I highly recommend this router. And hey it's cheap too.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product, but price keep increasing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of setup and cloud option to manage devices. Within 2 minutes SSID, Password, and Wifi working for my residence!! Strong wifi and I would recommend as I love routers with antennas as they broadcast signals the best!! Added note 10-13-15: Great unit, but price keeps increasing monthly which is making it less affordable as a unit I can use in my business.
customer_reviews.author: tkgibson

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy.
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, I don't have much to say. The router works exactly as it should and I've never experienced any kind of drop in service. There was a short period of confusion with the set up because I had never used a router in the past, but once I got it going, I've been very satisfied. However, I should disclose that I live in a 2BR apt., so there isn't tons of space between my devices and the router. But again, my experience with D-link has been positive.
customer_reviews.author: Ai

customer_reviews.title: This D-Link router is better than Linksys / Cisco Routers!  A great value, and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: This just works. It does everything I expect and hope that my router would do. Great antennas. This beets the crap out of my Linksys and Cisco routers that I've had before this that each lived less than a year under basic home use. I would recommend this over Linksys even though I used to be an exclusively Linksys man. Fast dependable wireless N. Better signal than Cisco / Linksys routers that don't have external antennas!
customer_reviews.author: Orweller Family

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my purchase as it serves its purpose and ...
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this refurbished item because i wanted to save money. I'm happy with my purchase as it serves its purpose and works well. I've only had it for a month so i can't comment on its longevity performance. I use this D-link router to stream movies from nextflix and basic web browsing and it performs well as im able to watch movies without any tech issues. So far, im satisfied with this item. I hope it lasts for as long as i need it. I would highly recommend it to those who would use it for movie streaming and basic web browsing.
customer_reviews.author: MRL

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than excpected
customer_reviews.text: This item ladiea and gents is a hell of a beast...not as in super powerful like those you would get for $100 and more, but for this price and the looks of it this little router is killong it. It is surprisingly awesome I recommend this a thousand times over a router of the same price. Did I tell you about that super cool app they made for it? Where you can see who is conected at all times and you can even check the history of the devices connected to it
customer_reviews.author: Freud

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with my Motorola cable modem and it seems to work great! Strong signal in my apartment everywhere, PS3 and laptop connected right away without any hiccups. it can be a pain to get it to work if the power goes out and is restored. Im not sure if its this router or my modem thats being a pain but it will eventually start working if i cycle power on the modem and the router in the right order. Once its working it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mrguy

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL, easy, and quality equipment
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced my aging Cisco Linksys E3000. This router BLOWS the old one out of the water as far as performance goes. I consistently get speeds of 27Mbps+ on a 30Mbps cable connection. My old router would give me 7Mbps on a good day. I'm not sure if it was defective, but it would constantly kick my HP printer from the network after idle. The Dlink leaves my printer on the network without a single issue. I could not be happier. Setup was a breeze. (If you have trouble auto-detecting your connection, reboot the modem and try again.)
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad, But Not The Best
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my father and found the setup to be a little more difficult than the Linksys and Netgear routers I typically use. After cancelling the setup "Wizard" after three unsuccessful attempts and manually setting things up, I finally got it working. People unfamiliar with how to manually setup a router should avoid this product. I gave it four stars instead of three because it has worked flawlessly for the past month.
customer_reviews.author: sazhazman

customer_reviews.title: Port Forwarding?
customer_reviews.text: Decent router but I had trouble opening ports. The trick is that the device that you are trying to port forward has to show up in the DHCP list. I had my device set up as a static IP and it would not forward the ports, even though they were in the static IP client list. Set up my devices for DHCP then set up the port forwarding rules and it worked. I also found this router only had slightly better wireless range than my Linksys WRT160N router.
customer_reviews.author: Scotcher

customer_reviews.title: Working real good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good !! Read a lot of the reviews and was torn about buying this. It was a mixed bag of reviews. But its working nicely for us for a week now. Besides our desktop we have three smartphones and a playstation 3 running off the wireless router. Signal is stong through out our house. I have about a 2000 square foot house with an upstairs and basement. Signal is very good throughout the house. I like it !
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Good product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The router came quickly and was easy to set up. I wanted it to replace one that would constantly stop working and need to be power cycled. I have had this one for over a month now and my only complaint is that it has had to be power cycled twice already. That knocked a star off my rating. Aside from that it has worked great. The web interface and android app that allow you to check it are also pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Sold New but was a Used Product out of the box - Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I purchased that was supposed to be new but it already had a user's SSID assigned. Unreliable. Would not stay connected to the internet. I've always had to reset it to to factory and start configuring it all over. I'm an IT guy too! It's over the 30 day period for return (only 30 days should have raised a red flag for me!) Now I'm stuck with this junk. I've left feedback. If the seller allows a refund, I will update my post here. Otherwise it remains as written.
customer_reviews.author: Wm. Joseph Gaeta

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Systems DIR-605L Wireless-N300 Cloud Router
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Wireless Router because I received a Kindle Fire HD for Christmas & needed a wireless network. The price of this router was reasonable. It was easy to install & does not take up alot of space. If you are looking for a wireless network that downloads fast you may want to get one bigger than this one. This one works great for the Kindle Fire & also works great for WiFi on your cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Teena Smith

customer_reviews.title: if you want to expand the wifi range and strength in your house i recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my wifi was very slow in my house for reason and wasnt reaching far enough. After i installed this, i got wifi where i needed it th most. if you want to expand the wifi range and strength in your house i recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Angelblaze

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: i was having a bit of a problem hooking this router up. called customer service got the most helpful young woman imaginable. she was very patient with me and explained how it all works. i forget her name but i have a ticket #(c6302257) we need more people like her, thanks for your help. oh and the router is great i have my kindle fire,my gateway desktop,my lg phone,and my roku all connected and everything is running great.
customer_reviews.author: edgar davila

customer_reviews.title: Good but subpar admin software
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but found the admin pages to be clunky. I was able to do almost all that I wanted, so I guess it's just that the admin software is different than others. The main issue that I have with the admin pages is that the MAC filtering applies to all connections rather than just wireless connections. I could see that a business or public situation may need to block wired connections by MAX address but why would a home user want to block a wired connection?
customer_reviews.author: Darnit78

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this item because I did not know how to change the password on my current one. Well I figured it out and I no longer needed this router. I contacted customer service about returning it. The company was great, understanding and efficient. It was a pleasure how easy they made it to return. I would recommend this company and will purchase products from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ms p

customer_reviews.title: When it works
customer_reviews.text: When this device works, it's fast. No lagging on streams from mu Roku (my primary source for video). I connected it in march and have ha to call D-Link tec support three times. The device seems to loose itsconnection. When this happens, my equiptment still finds the router, but everything times out. You cant just log in and fix the settings, you have to push the reset button and restart from scratch. I chose this router because of the 'My D-Link' capability to remotely manage other devices without the use of a pc, prefering instead to use Android tabs and phones.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Allen

customer_reviews.title: Hard to go wrong with it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, small, N router. Simple setup, works great. The D-Link web site was simple and complete. Note: The first one of these that I ordered "disappeared" between the OnTrac delivery truck and my front door, but after talking to Amazon's customer service, the second one arrived without incident. I found Amazon's customer service to be friendly and helpful in this case.
customer_reviews.author: srdowns

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, install was a breeze. This was a replacement for my old router that kicked my hard wired pc off and timed connections out several times an hour. This one has not dropped me once which is a huge plus. The range is not quite as good as the one I had but it was a decent option for a budget router. Have no complaints other than the somewhat short range (it reaches the whole house just not too far into the yard) however in a crowded neighborhood or apartment building this would come in handy (less people to try to mooch) Bottom line: Great router, very user friendly, set it and forget it so far.
customer_reviews.author: M. Richards

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR CUSTOMER SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: Called D-link with questions and put on hold for one hour so gave up. Emailed customer support with questions- immediately answered "thanks for your question" but never got an answer. Called next day and put on hold 45 minutes. I gave up and returned router.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Rose

customer_reviews.title: A worthy replacement to my home router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace my linksys/cisco router because it was a piece of junk. Cisco quality has really gone down since they rebranded the linksys products. As it stands now, I had to reboot the thing once every couple of days. The D-Link router has performed very well so far and has not needed to be restarted. It's fast and easy to configure.
customer_reviews.author: W. Watson

customer_reviews.title: I got a dud.
customer_reviews.text: There was a coupon for the router so I jumped and bought it to replace my aging Netgear router. When I installed it though it caused all kinds of problems - local network and Internet connections were intermittent and kept dropping. After taking this router offline and replacing it with the aging Netgear everything went back to normal. No other choice but return it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: kalihiboy

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Since my old Netgear N wireless (not very old actually) quit working and calling the out-of-this-country customer service was less than pleasant - they (laughingly) wanted me to purchase a one hundred dollar (life-time) warranty since my product was out-of-warranty and for them to "fix" my Netgear I needed warranty... endless loop of laughable frustration. Hitting my head on a brick wall would have been more help. So, I threw the Netgear away (a wasteful shame) and went to Amazon to find a replacement. This D-Link was a great price and arrived very fast - easy to set up, no problems at all. The range is much broader also, so I am happy with this D-Link router!
customer_reviews.author: Aud

customer_reviews.title: I had concerns about not getting wireless connections but thanks to Ivy in customer service(which is awesome! ) I had my laptop
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was speedy. I had concerns about not getting wireless connections but thanks to Ivy in customer service(which is awesome!) I had my laptop running wirelessly! And I have a faster speed than my old router!! It is a pleasure dealing with such great tech support.I truly LLOVE my little DLink router.!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Mae

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, dependable no-fault service
customer_reviews.text: After deciding I will NEVER buy another Belkin router again, I went back to D-Link for dependable no-fault service. I do not have time to waste fooling around with setup glitches and wavering service. This D-Link router fills the bill and has great range as well. Love it! Just a note... I have been using this router for about a year now with flawless performance.
customer_reviews.author: DesignWise Studios

customer_reviews.title: Custoner Service is Great
customer_reviews.text: Well, I just purchased the router a couple weeks ago and my husband had problems setting it up. After much procrastination, I tried to set it up and couldn't figure out how to do it. I called their technical support and a customer service rep, Angela, walked me through it and I have a fabulous connection. Will update as we use this router; but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Verified customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a good while under a lot of stress and demands from ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a good while under a lot of stress and demands from me. The software is very limited and kind of hard to navigate. Instructions are not clear and would not recommend to a none tech savy person.
customer_reviews.author: NightTech

customer_reviews.title: Great Wifi Router
customer_reviews.text: D-Link Wireless N 300 works very well for me. When I plug in the power adapter (there's no power switch) it takes about a minute to be able to access the internet. I also use it for wifi for my Samsung Galaxy S2. It sits behind my French doors that are always left open. The signal is strong in my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Saxon M.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job but always kicks me off!
customer_reviews.text: Does its job but every morning I wake up to find that the wifi has kicked me off on my iPhone. It's annoying to have to re-connect manually every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Georgina Smith

customer_reviews.title: NOT NEW
customer_reviews.text: This was a refurbished piece that was not actually refurbished. The set-up guide was missing and the network name had not been reset to the factory standard as labeled. The item was not advertised as refurbished. The product still works, and better than our old router, but having to spend an hour figuring out how to reset the damned thing so we could set it up in the first place was not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Great reception
customer_reviews.text: I get great reception out in my living room and in my bedroom, which are both in opposite corners of the house from the office where the router is situated. Installation wasn't as easy as I thought it would be. I had to talk to the company and my internet provider before I could get it hooked up. But, once up and running I've had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: jolivesincos

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.  Fairly easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain at all. Have had it up and running for more than a week now. The most difficult part was disconnecting my old router with the tangled wires and resetting my devices to the new network. Took me a bit more than half an hour for everything. Excellent download speed on all devices, which is more than I can say for my old Netgear router.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Chaffee

customer_reviews.title: Issues with dropped internet
customer_reviews.text: I am less than 20 feet away from the router and sometimes the wireless internet would stop working. My laptop would show a strong signal, but webpages just won't load. Computers connected directly via ethernet has no issues. This was encountered with both a Lenovo Thinkpad T420 with Intel 6205 and HP Pavilion DV4. Don't know what the issue is, but it looks like D-link is no longer making reliable routers.
customer_reviews.author: damasta55

customer_reviews.title: It works really well....
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work really well... I do not know how well a router of this type is supposed to work but, seems good to me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for your hard earned dollar!
customer_reviews.text: D-Link is my current go to because of their design and the fact that they usually dont begin to die in a year or two. Typically a lot of routers' wifi dies within the first year or two. D-Link products have stayed stable for me and my customers for 5+ years. That and the price tage of $25 bucks was unbelievable. For your home budget and hard earned dollar this is the best choice for the lowest price.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Brothers Solutions CEO

customer_reviews.title: Solid working router with a nice app to monitor status remotely
customer_reviews.text: Solid router, works as advertised. I have been a D-Link fan for several years. This model I can monitor status and reboot it using their Phone App... I have never had to reboot it. It works well at small vet's office. I have another one (second unit) working well at our neighborhood clubhouse providing WiFi access inside and around the pool area w/ no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to install a simple WiFi network in my parents home and for my special needs sister. Nothing fancy, but it works for their basic web browsing and email. Seamless installation and the range is adequate for what they need.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: I fought with this router and my internet connection for a month. It turns out that after my cable internet provider replaced the cable modem that the router would intermittently disrupt the internet signal. I had to return it and go back to my 6+ year old d-link router. I guess they don't make them like they use to any more...
customer_reviews.author: MongoGrubb

customer_reviews.title: Returned and getting something better. You pay what you get for
customer_reviews.text: Could not get router to connect and instructions were incorrect. Returned and getting something better. You pay what you get for.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: A solid router that provides excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I use this router both wired (gaming) and wireless (laptops, tablets). The router has worked flawlessly since being installed and I have never once had the connection drop. Connected devices are usually in the same room, so I don't have much experience with testing the reliability with a longer range. Overall, for the price it is a cost-effective solution.
customer_reviews.author: CSprings

customer_reviews.title: Never Ending Problems
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly tech savy and have struggled to get this new router to work. Initially I worked with D-Link to make adjustments to settings to get it to work properly. It functioned for a while, but then began to not connect properly or connect at a slow tranfer rate. I isolated my problem to this router each time by connecting my computer directly to my modem, bypassing the router, and confirming everything work fine without it. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: zepli

customer_reviews.title: Great router... for the first 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I had this router set up for about 6 months and never thought twice about it again (like all good routers). All of a sudden last week it started cutting out every 4 minutes and then two days ago died completely. I could connect to the router, but it did not recognize that there was an internet connection. Connecting to the modem directly was fine. Connecting through the router was useless. And computers is my job, so I am confident it was not user error. Got a new router today and its fine. I just think that a router should last more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Ana

customer_reviews.title: ... for about a week now and it's performing just fine. Haven't used any of the extra features
customer_reviews.text: Had this set up for about a week now and it's performing just fine. Haven't used any of the extra features, but coverage inside my house is complete. I stream a few movies and that part is working fine as well. Don't know what else you can say about a router - it either works or it doesn't. This one does.
customer_reviews.author: El Gordo

customer_reviews.title: Forget the 'plug and play' advertisements. It took nearly ...
customer_reviews.text: Forget the 'plug and play' advertisements. It took nearly an hour on the phone with Dlink support to get the system configured. The tech must be supporting a lot of different models because he didn't seem familiar with this model.
customer_reviews.author: uncledevo

customer_reviews.title: didn't come with installation paperwork
customer_reviews.text: It quit working altogether when I had it for about 3 weeks and my tablet kept telling me to push the reset button which I could not find then someone gave me another router which worked but I wanted the dlink to work, so finally I found a pinhole and assumed it to be the reset and I pushed it with a paperclip and finally it started working. no problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: betsy muro

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more money and get a better router
customer_reviews.text: It works okay, and was a decent price, but every device that connects to it has occasional drop outs. Good signal strength, then, disconnected, nothing there, then a few seconds later, good signal strength. It doesn't happen a lot, but it is very annoying. No interference in the area, it just occasionally loses it.
customer_reviews.author: jsansa

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I am by far not technologically inclined, but I was able to set up this router on my own. Easily. I had it installed within 15 mins of opening the box. I chose it because of the other reviews and the price. It puts out a good strong signal all over my 1200sq ft. apartment. I would buy it again. *Update 12/12- Drops signal constantly. Bad Buy.
customer_reviews.author: priss2121

customer_reviews.title: Impossibly complex to install
customer_reviews.text: After three sessions and 8 hours with a DLink tech, I finally gave up. I have hired a wireless tech to get it working. The meager installation instructs that come packaged with the router are laughably inadequate. Then, if one tries to use the online manual, its length and complexity are also daunting.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Speedy...
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. I actually had purchase one a while ago on ebay but wanted another one for a different network option within my home. The signal is strong, data transfer is always constant without much fluctuation in quality at all and after almost 5 months on the first one, I have yet to have to reboot it.
customer_reviews.author: itsjustme

customer_reviews.title: D-Link N-300
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an old D-Link router with the N-300 and had no problems at all. The two Windows 7 laptops found the signal right away and two Roku units also. If you are replacing a D-Link router just remember to use DLINK2 when attaching your devices. Total time was about 30 minutes to hook up all devices. Priced right also.
customer_reviews.author: dbatch1715

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Nice sleek and small easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.author: Kidsmom101

customer_reviews.title: Just Installed
customer_reviews.text: So far this router is screaming fast. The setup was easy, but did require some waiting and restarts to get it all up and running. My computers and devices are loading pages at hyper-space speeds. I'll update if I have any issues. If this is over two weeks old and there are no updates then everything is golden
customer_reviews.author: Wlinc

product_meta.title: D-Link Wireless N 300 Mbps Home Cloud App-Enabled Broadband Router (DIR-605L)
product_meta.description:
The D-Link Cloud Router gives you peace of mind when you're away and gives you a fast network when you're at home.With this router, you can quickly and easily control and monitor your home network from anywhere by downloading the free mydlink Lite App from the Apple iTunes Store or Android Market. View what devices are on your home network and what sites are being visited, which is great for parents. Wireless N300 technology offers more speed, extended coverage and virtually no dead spots while still being compatible with previous wireless network standards. Just use the easy setup wizard to create a secure wireless network in minutes.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER



The fast D-Link Home Cloud Router gives you great performance and lets you see who's doing what on your network from anywhere--great for families wanting extra piece of mind. 



The Wireless N 300 Home Cloud Router 
(view larger).

KEY FEATURES





Available apps for iPhone and Android smartphones.



PEACE OF MIND WHEN YOU'RE AWAY
Who says you have to be at home to keep track of your wireless network? The "Cloud" is all about being able to do what you want from wherever you're at. With the Cloud Control, you can simply download D-Link's free iPad, iPhone, or Android mydlink app and do the following from anywhere: 

FAST WIRELESS N 300 SPEED, GREAT COVERAGE
The Cloud Router gives you a fast home network--up to 300Mbps--for accessing broadband Internet, sharing files, and more. Wireless N technology offers more speed, extended coverage, and virtually no dead spots while still being compatible with previous wireless network standards. This router is ideal for medium-sized or large homes. 

The Cloud Router includes four Fast Ethernet ports, giving you the flexibility to connect wired devices to the network. The Cloud Router uses Intelligent Antenna technology to transmit multiple streams of data by bouncing multiple wireless signals off of walls enabling you to receive wireless signals in the farthest corners of your home. 

EASY TO INSTALL AND USE
With the D-Link Easy Setup Wizard, you can set up your wireless network in minutes. The wizard will guide you through a simple process to install your new hardware, connect to your network, and add new devices. It configures your Internet Service Provider (ISP) settings to quickly establish broadband Internet connectivity. In addition, the Cloud Router is Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) certified, making it even easier to configure your wireless network and enable security. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Cloud Router, Ethernet cable, power adapter, quick start guide




See more
feature_bullets: N300 Technology : Performance and reliable coverage for everyday web activities; 14x speed of Wireless G routers
Simple Setup : Get your router up and running in minutes with the QRS Mobile App
Remote network monitoring with free Smartphone app
mydlink Service for Push Event, User Control, View Real time Browsing History, and Remotely Connect and Disconnect Computer Devices from the Network
Total compatibility : Works with any WiFi certified device, giving you reliable performance
Wired Connectivity : Four Fast Ethernet ports for fast device connectivity
Total security : Complete set of security features including an SPI firewall and WPA2 to protect your network against intruders
Traffic Control and Time Scheduling, Wireless Frequency Range: 24 GHz to 24835 GHz
Standards : IEEE 80211n : up to 300 Mbps / IEEE 80211g / IEEE 8023 / IEEE 8023u

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,236 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
